summary: AI Cricket Umpire web app (React + TypeScript/Vite with an Internet Computer backend) being renamed to "MR.AI UMPIRE" and requested to be deployed permanently instead of expiring daily; user also requests the website source/HTML and asks to fix any glitches.
architectural_notes: Frontend is a React + TypeScript application built with Vite (not a single HTML file; UI generated by React components; index.html is a loader).
Project mentions an Internet Computer backend integration.
known_issues: Draft app deployments expire daily (temporary previews), causing the user to lose access to the draft unless rebuilt/redeployed.

existing_features.title: Perform an end-to-end QA pass of the app (camera/recording, upload, analysis playback, theme toggle, navigation/back flow) and fix any runtime errors, broken UI states, or obvious regressions found during manual testing.
Fix branding/UI text inconsistencies so the app name is displayed as "MR.AI UMPIRE" in the header (and any other visible places) instead of the old name.

Resolve obvious frontend code issues that can cause glitches: remove or implement empty placeholder components that are part of the current build (e.g., an empty component file), and ensure the theme toggle behaves correctly when the theme is set to "system".

new_feature_requests.summary: Convert daily-expiring draft deployment into a permanent production deployment (stop expiration).
Provide the full website source code export (not a single HTML file).
Optional: create a simple static HTML version/demo of the UI (no React/backend) if requested.
Run through the app for glitches and fix any bugs/regressions found.
